prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 1
Name: Ernest Amano
Description: Benefactor when I studied in Germany. Director of the Amano Group.
Character 2
Name: Lance Amano
Description: Son of Ernest Amano. Victim of the kidnapping. I knew him when he was a child.
Character 3
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Self-purported Great Thief. She suddenly appeared, but why was she stalking me?
Character 4
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol Agent. He is in charge of this kidnapping case for some odd reason.
Character 5
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 6
Name: Oliver Deacon
Description: Amano family butler, and Lance's private tutor. Could not be contacted recently.
Character 7
Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Precinct police officer. Was conducting investigation while in Blue Badger costume.
Character 8
Name: Lauren Paups
Description: Lance Amano's girlfriend. Came to Gatewater Land in search of Lance.
Character 9
Name: Ema Skye
Description: High schooler in Europe to become forensic scientist. On school break.
Character 10
Name: Security Lady
Description: The lady inside the Pink Badger. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Gatewater Land Pamphlet
Description: Map and explanation of park attractions listed.
Evidence 2
Name: Bad Badger's Head
Description: Costumes separate into head and body. This head was left in the Isolation Room.
Evidence 3
Name: Blue Badger Bible
Description: Book detailing info on the whole Badger family.
Evidence 4
Name: Badger Photo Rally
Description: There's only 1 of each Badger in the park. Try to get the whole Badger family!
Evidence 5
Name: Stolen Costumes
Description: The kidnappers stole three costumes: a Blue, a Proto and a Bad Badger. Blue Badger = Lauren Paups Proto Badger = Lance Amano Bad Badger = Oliver Deacon
Evidence 6
Name: Preliminary Findings → Mr. Deacon's Murder Notes
Description: Victim: Oliver Deacon. Seems he was shot dead. Victim, Deacon, shot from ABD through shoulder. Body was moved. Shot from ABD through shoulder.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Deacon's Pendant
Description: It's shaped like a horse. "Colin Devorae" is engraved on the back.
Evidence 8
Name: Blue Badgermobile
Description: Mobile shop on three wheels. Was parked inside Wild, Wild West area garage.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Costume
Description: He was likely wearing one due to the footprints' shape and the lack of blood. Worn at the time of the shooting. Gunpowder burn is proof he was shot from point blank.
Evidence 10
Name: Love Letter
Description: Letter for Lance Amano. The sender is the "Tender Lender Loan Company".
Evidence 11
Name: Colin Devorae Dossier
Description: Details Oliver Deacon's real name and history. [info]Caolin Devorae
Sex: Male
Dominant Hand: Right
Height: 5'8"
Weight: 123.45 lbs

Whereabouts unknown after his escape from Penn E. Dent Prison. Stole a gun from a guard during his scape. We thought he might head for where his wife and sole daughter are, but despite our surveillance, he has yet to show up.
Evidence 12
Name: Broken Prop Sword
Description: Was used to jam the handle to the hideout's door from the inside. Culprit hit me in the right temple area with this.
Evidence 13
Name: Missing Model Gun
Description: Was ripped from the Bad Badger costume. It's capable of firing blanks.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Paups's Pendant
Description: It's shaped like a pair of wings. "Lauren D." is engraved on the back.
Evidence 15
Name: Revolver
Description: Used to kill Deacon. Was originally stolen from guard by victim during escape.
Evidence 16
Name: Mirror Fragments
Description: These were found inside the victim's costume. Why were they there in the first place? Different from the mirrors on the walls. Very thick and has a design on the back.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I'll grant you that the two of them are father and daughter.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: But, isn't it possible that they both knew that fact?
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was no coincidence that the reunited pair became involved in the house of Amano.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: And the two of them made good use of their meetings to plan this little kidnapping.
Person: Lang
Testimony 4
Testimony: Wouldn't you say my scenario is perfectly probable as well?
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 11 (Colin Devorae Dossier) states that Oliver Deacon is actually Colin Devorae, who escaped from prison and stole a gun during his escape. It mentions that despite surveillance, he has yet to show up at the location where his wife and daughter are.

Testimonies 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 by Lang point towards a scenario where a reunited pair (implying a close relationship such as family) made use of their meetings to plan the kidnapping in the house of Amano. Lang implies that the people involved in the kidnapping are connected and orchestrated the plan knowingly. This suggests that Oliver Deacon (Colin Devorae) is involved in the kidnapping and that he and presumably another (maybe his daughter) were actively planning it together.

Thus, the dossier (Evidence 11) directly contradicts Lang’s testimonies (Testimony 3, for example) because it states that Colin Devorae has not been seen, implying he is not present to plan or participate in the kidnapping at the house of Amano. Meanwhile, Lang says the pair conspiring in the kidnapping used their meetings (meaning they have met in person recently).

The contradiction is between Evidence 11 and Testimony 3.

Whereabouts unknown after his escape from Penn E. Dent Prison. Stole a gun from a guard during his scape. We thought he might head for where his wife and sole daughter are, but despite our surveillance, he has yet to show up.
Evidence 12
Name: Broken Prop Sword
Description: Was used to jam the handle to the hideout's door from the inside. Culprit hit me in the right temple area with this.
Lance: They must've used some drug to knock me out. Because before I knew it, I was off in La-La Land again. When I woke up, I was in the kidnappers' hideout already, all tied up.
Evidence 13

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was kidnapped yesterday morning.
Person: Lance
Testimony 1
Testimony: They had me shut in that room, blindfolded, the entire time.
Person: Lance
Testimony 2
Testimony: But the kidnappers suddenly disappeared around the time I heard rain falling outside.
Person: Lance
Testimony 3
Testimony: My hands were cuffed, but it was a stroke of luck that they left me alone.
Person: Lance
Testimony 4
Testimony: I made my escape and ran away from that room as fast as I could.
Person: Lance
Testimony 5
Testimony: The door leading outside was locked tight, so I had to use the underground passageway.
Person: Lance

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 says "My hands were cuffed, but it was a stroke of luck that they left me alone," implying Lance was restrained and left unattended for some time. Testimony 4 states "I made my escape and ran away from that room as fast as I could," indicating he was able to get free and escape.

However, Evidence 12 mentions the Broken Prop Sword was used to jam the door from the inside and that Lance said, "They must've used some drug to knock me out." This suggests the kidnappers were present and took precautions to keep Lance inside the room, making their eventual disappearance and the opportunity given to Lance (testimony 3 and 4) questionable.

The contradiction is particularly clear between Evidence 12 and Testimony 3, as the evidence implies the kidnappers were present and actively preventing escape, contradicting that Lance's hands were cuffed but that the kidnappers had actually left him alone.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Make no mistake. There are fingerprints on that murderous gun.
Person: Lance
Testimony 1
Testimony: And they prove that it was Lolli who killed Oliver.
Person: Lance
Testimony 2
Testimony: But Oliver was also after Lolli's life.
Person: Lance
Testimony 3
Testimony: So Mr. Edgeworth, even you must see that Lolli was only acting in self-defense.
Person: Lance

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
The contradiction lies between Evidence 6 (Preliminary Findings → Mr. Deacon's Murder Notes) and Testimonies 0-3 by Lance.

Evidence 6 states clearly that Oliver Deacon is the victim who was shot and killed. However, Lance's testimonies (0 through 3) speak as if "Lolli" killed Oliver and Oliver was also after Lolli's life, implying an ongoing conflict between Lolli and Oliver.

If Lance is implying that Lolli killed Oliver (Testimony 1) and Oliver was also after Lolli's life (Testimony 2), it conflicts with the fact that Oliver is the deceased victim as per the official evidence. The contradiction is about the identity of the murderer and the victim relationship, especially given Lance's thoughts in Testimony 3 defending Lolli's action as self-defense.

Given the provided options, a direct contradiction can be seen between Evidence 6, which clearly identifies Oliver as the victim, and Lance’s testimonies implying the interaction and conflict with "Lolli" which suggests an alternative context about the murder.

Hence, the pair that directly contradict are the evidence of Oliver's murder (Evidence 6) and Lance's testimony claiming "Lolli" killed Oliver in self-defense (Testimony 3).
